isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - HEATER AND AIR CONDITIONER - OPERATION - Heater Bunk W/PRO SLEEPER W/Standard Temperature Control

svcproc.title: Heater Bunk W/PRO SLEEPER W/Standard Temperature Control
svcproc.para: When the ignition switch is ON, power flows in through circuit 12E and out through 12-GE and 11-GBE to energize aux bunk relay (147). Thus when the bunk blower switch is moved to the low speed position, power flows from B2 battery stud, through circuit 14AK, 14AU, fuse F10-A, circuit 75W, relay (147) contacts, circuit 75X, 75AG, bunk blower switch, circuit 75AD, and the full resistor network and thermo fuse assembly to sleeper blower motor. The ground circuit for the blower motor is circuit 75-GAE, 11-GAG, 11-GBC, 11-GBD and 11-GBE to ground adapter (454).

When the bunk blower switch is moved to the medium position, power flows as described above to the bunk blower switch, then through circuit 75AC, then through half of the sleeper blower resistor network and the thermo fuse, and blower circuits previously described.

When the bunk blower switch is moved to the high position, power flows as described above to the bunk blower switch. Then power flows through circuit 75AF to energize high speed blower relay (584) and flows through ground circuit 75-GR. This allows power to flow from aux bunk blower relay through circuits 75X and 75AA to high speed blower relay (584). Power then flows through relay (584) contacts, circuit 75AB, then without going through any of the sleeper blower resistor network, it flows through the thermo fuse to the sleeper blower motor.

A motorized damper door is located between the sleeper and the heater/air conditioner box located in the cab under the passenger's seat. Power is fed to this motorized damper on circuit 75AP, and the ground path in circuit 75-GK, 11-GAF, 11-GBC, 11-GBD, and 11-GBE to ground adapter (454).

The control circuitry for the damper consists of the following: power flows through circuit 75AH, through winter/summer switch, circuit 75AM, temperature control, circuit 75AN, and circuit 75-GS to ground circuit for damper control. Thus a variable voltage is available from the temperature control on circuit 75AL to regulate the damper by its motor.
By moving the winter/summer switch to its other position, the relationship of open/cool and closed/warm is switched to open/warm and closed/cool.

note.para: This is the standard manual temperature control so the output of the system does not change with temperature, just the initial setting.
